content: bumble bee hot pad designed by andres p nevarez aka crafty andy bumble bee hot pad materials 2 oz of cotton worsted weight yellow 2 oz of cotton worsted weight black some white red and brown yarn for face g or h crochet hook definitions chain = chain st = stitch sts = stitches single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet this whole pattern is made in single_crochet stitch using two strands of yarn all the time you may carry unused yarn along the work or just cut and switch to the new color as you go the pattern is starting at the stinger row 1 suggested coloring is 3 row black 3 row yellow 3 row black 3 row yellow 2 row black 4 row yellow 8 row black 4 row yellow 4 row black 3 row yellow 7 row black you may create your own bee color pattern body row 1 with black chain 10 leaving a long enough tail around 12 inches to work the stinger later on single_crochet on second chain from hook chain 1 turn row 2 2 single_crochet in st just made row 3 12 keep increasing one stitch at the beginning of each row chain 1 turn row 13-17 now keep increasing one stitch at the beginning and end of each row remember to chain 1 and turn and to single_crochet in 1 st single_crochet at end of row 17 you will have 22 stitches row 18 -30 single_crochet across chain 1 turn row 31- 44 decrease single_crochet at the beginning of each row end until you have 8 stitches left for the neck of the bee continue until row 44 with 8 single_crochet finish off head make one ha ha ha you need humor as well with 2 strands of black chain 5 slip st to join and make a ring row1 ch3 double_crochet in same st 2 double_crochet in each st throughout 8 double_crochet slip st to beginning ch3 row2 ch3 double_crochet in first double_crochet 2 double_crochet in each st throughout 16 double_crochet finish off with white make the eyes with the brown the nose and with red the mouth remember you do not turn and you will choose 8 sts to attach to the body attach to the body legs make 6 with two strands of black chain 13 single_crochet in second chain from loop across do not finish off leaving a tail to sew unto body of bee it is an insect so try to make the legs as equidistant as possible 3 legs on each side ©crafty andy 2009 - copyright information you are not to make for mass manual or commercial production for profit using this pattern you may not sell or alter this pattern make a loose knot antennae
